body: Thanks @bern4rdelli
@NielsZeilemaker could you check?

@Fokko In theory I'd agree with you, but we came across multiple cases where ,while downloading several pages, there is a random connection issue or the API misbehaves. Adding the tenacity layer saved us from many consecutive failures and saved us plenty of time when downloading several pages from an u stable endpoint. 
Anyway I'm curious too see what's the other committers opinion on this.
I have created a new Pull Request https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3073 to resolve the issue @renanleme
cc @Fokko

@Fokko I haven't used Pandas GBQ but I would do it in few days and update it here in case this PR is still open. 

@mremes Can you confirm that you have tried using `get_pandas_df()` method? Can you provide an example over here?
@Fokko : No, I've never used it. The library is also being used in pandas btw: https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/generated/pandas.read_gbq.html

@kaxil using the hook in a custom operator. `get_pandas_df()` broke when `pandas-gbq` dependency is updated to [version 0.3.1](https://github.com/pydata/pandas-gbq/tree/0.3.1). It's doing what is expected, as can be read from the `read_gbq` docstring.
This is about replacing 2 years old code 😜I don't remember the state of the project at that stage. Pretty dangerous use of private methods though...
Thank you @mremes @hgrif. I think this should be fine @Fokko

@kaxil CI is failing:
```
======================================================================
1) FAIL: test_cli_connections_list (tests.CliTests)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
   Traceback (most recent call last):
    tests/core.py line 1042 in test_cli_connections_list
      self.assertIn(['bigquery_default', 'bigquery'], conns)
   AssertionError: ['bigquery_default', 'bigquery'] not found in [[u'airflow_db', u'mysql'], [u'airflow_ci', u'mysql'], [u'beeline_default', u'beeline'], [u'bigquery_default', u'google_cloud_platform'], [u'local_mysql', u'mysql'], [u'presto_default', u'presto'], [u'google_cloud_default', u'google_cloud_platform'], [u'hive_cli_default', u'hive_cli'], [u'hiveserver2_default', u'hiveserver2'], [u'metastore_default', u'hive_metastore'], [u'mysql_default', u'mysql'], [u'postgres_default', u'postgres'], [u'sqlite_default', u'sqlite'], [u'http_default', u'http'], [u'mssql_default', u'mssql'], [u'vertica_default', u'vertica'], [u'wasb_default', u'wasb'], [u'webhdfs_default', u'hdfs'], [u'ssh_default', u'ssh'], [u'fs_default', u'fs'], [u'aws_default', u'aws'], [u'spark_default', u'spark'], [u'druid_ingest_default', u'druid'], [u'redis_default', u'redis'], [u'sqoop_default', u'sqoop'], [u'emr_default', u'emr'], [u'databricks_default', u'databricks'], [u'qubole_default', u'qubole']]
```
@mremes Thanks for updating. I agree that using private methods is not good practice. But I've never used the code, so thanks @kaxil and @hgrif for taking a look at it. Cheers!
@Fokko I am looking into it. Will update you once I resolve it

@Fokko I had first changed the failed test (`test_cli_connections_list `) to below:
```python
self.assertIn(['bigquery_default', 'google_cloud_platform'], conns)
```
The CI failed this for `backed_sqlite` & `backend_postgres`, however it passed for the rest which you can see [here](https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-airflow/builds/345754806). 

This was because of the way the test (`test_cli_connections_list`) is written. The test grabs the content from the command line and uses regex to extract the required information.
```python
    def test_cli_connections_list(self):
        with mock.patch('sys.stdout',
                        new_callable=six.StringIO) as mock_stdout:
            cli.connections(self.parser.parse_args(['connections', '--list']))
            stdout = mock_stdout.getvalue()
        conns = [[x.strip("'") for x in re.findall("'\w+'", line)[:2]]
                 for ii, line in enumerate(stdout.split('\n'))
                 if ii % 2 == 1]
        conns = [conn for conn in conns if len(conn) > 0]
```

Now the command line strips longer names and presents it as `...`, so instead of `google_cloud_platform` it may show `google...platform...` and instead of `druid_ingest_default` it would end of showing `druid_..._default` (Screenshot 2). Hence the regex won't be able to match it when the space in cli is low and it displays `...` instead of correct names.

**Screenshot 1:** 
Travis CI report ([link](https://travis-ci.org/kaxil/incubator-airflow/jobs/345754777#L5102)) showing that because of the dots, the connection list obtained using regex only contain `[u'bigquery_default']` instead of `[u'bigquery_default', u'google_cloud_platform']` and similar with `druid`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8811558/36635866-694f20dc-19e2-11e8-9646-5bee210cec4d.png)

**Screenshot 2:** 
The screengrab obtained from command line when the connections are listed. You can check using `airflow connections -l`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8811558/36636001-a4ef3bbc-19e3-11e8-9eff-68d4ec894c64.png)

Hence, I have removed the below line from the test as the main purpose of this test was to assert that some of the connections present in the output are as expected which is already done where the connection name and connection types have short string length.

```python
self.assertIn(['bigquery_default', 'google_cloud_platform'], conns)
```

The Travis CI has now passed..

Can you explain why the default retry mechanism does not suffice?
@night0wl any updates?

Thanks, but we can extend travis to include mesos. This will help you in the future as well as we can ensure any follow up changes do not break. So can you please add the mesos dependencies and make sure the tests are activated on Travis?
ping @aoen

Thanks for the review @fokko, I have some reasons to disable it on Travis:

- AFAIR accessing pidfile doesn't work as expected on Travis for some environmental reason. Strangely, when I tried to run this test on Travis, it seemed to cause another test failure.
- This test uses another thread to kill gunicorn with some delay. It's non-deterministic and can occur transient test failure.

Instead of enabling this on Travis, I ran it locally and confirmed that it succeeded.

@bolkedebruin I totally agree with your thoughts but the problem with extending travis to include mesos is that I would have to build mesos from source since the mesos python bindings are not `pip` installable, neither the python eggs are available for direct download which can be then `easy_install`ed. I've opened an issue in Mesos for making those eggs available for downlaod (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MESOS-8597) to resolve that. 

Do you want me to build mesos from source and then extract eggs out of it? It takes approximately half an hour on my macbook Pro. Not sure about the configuration of travis build machine but If we can afford to add that much time to the travis build, please let me know.

@sekikn Thanks for elaboration on the problem. I think we should find a way of isolating these tests. For me, a test that isn't automated, is as valuable as no test. I hope you understand, and this is something at the core of Airflow, so we have to make sure that it is tested well.

@arcward Thank you. This are some remainders of some of the refactoring that I've did recently. Sorry for the mess.

We are trying to increase the code quality by applying flake8. Currently there are some Flake8 violations reported by Travis, would you mind fixing these? Then I'll merge. Thanks!

@bolkedebruin the default retry mechanism is insufficient when the API has intermittent "bad response" or the network is unstable. 
i.e.:
I am downloading a response from an api and the response is splitter into 10 pages. My task has 3 retries with exponential backoff. The workload would look like:
[Task Start]

- Try:1 - bad handshake while downloading page 5 - [Task Run Failed]
- Try:2 - Bad handshake error while downloading page 7 - [Task Run Failed]
- Try:2 - Bad handshake error while downloading page 10 - [Task Run Failed]

[Task Fails]

With tenacity retry the workflow would be:
[Task Start]

- Try:1 
 - bad handshake while downloading page 5 - [Tenacity backs off and gives a chance for the API to heal] - [Download Succeed]
 - Bad handshake error while downloading page 7 [Tenacity backs off and gives a chance for the API to heal] - [Download Succeed]

[Task Succeed]

I hope this example shows better the use case. Let me know if you need further examples/explanations.

@Fokko flake8 failed on an existing violation that was only triggered because it resulted in a diff:

"_module level import not at top of file_" is shown because this is at the bottom of `airflow.__init__.py` : 
```
from airflow import operators
from airflow import hooks
from airflow import executors
from airflow import macros

operators._integrate_plugins()
hooks._integrate_plugins()
executors._integrate_plugins()
macros._integrate_plugins()
```

I added two lines (for sensors): 

```
from airflow import operators
from airflow import sensors
from airflow import hooks
from airflow import executors
from airflow import macros

operators._integrate_plugins()
sensors._integrate_plugins()
hooks._integrate_plugins()
executors._integrate_plugins()
macros._integrate_plugins()
```

It's not really avoidable since the violations were already there, so I'm not sure how to override them (and fixing that section entirely would involve quite a bit more refactoring unrelated to the enhancement)

Thanks
Any idea when this might be merged?

Hi @bolkedebruin, I'm Kevin from Airbnb, greetings. I would love to revisit the change included in this PR and iterate on it, and try to get it merged. After reading the related threads, my understanding is that your major concern on this change is adding tech debt on legacy logic, ie try_number as ti log identifier, right? If that's the case, I'll try to dive on that part and see if we can find a solution we all agree on, otherwise please let me know about your concerns and I'll draft another corresponding change to iterate on. Thank you!
@Fokko - The PR author has not responded to previous queries.  Is it possible someone else can adopt and do what's needed to the PR to get it merged?
I understand your concern. I'll update the PR if I come up with some good solution. Thanks :)

@unlikelyzero yes, now! 

@moe-nadal-ck Thanks for your contribution!

Hi @yrqls21, you need to implement a `FileTaskHandler`:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/tree/master/airflow/utils/log 
This will implement the writing, appending, deleting of the logs to ElasticSearch. I noticed that the implementation is rather old, a lot has been changed in Airflow 1.9 regarding logging:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/master/UPDATING.md#logging-update

I'm looking forward to your work, Elastic would be a very good backend for logging for Airflow.
@someword Are you using this? The code is old and untested.
@sekikn Thanks!
@thesquelched  Please fix the CI
Defer to #2691
Hello @bolkedebruin . Tests are passing. Can this PR be merged?
@Fokko - i am using it and it works great.
@syquus There is a merge conflict, please rebase on master and resolve the conflict.

@Fokko 
_"When I try to install using pip install -e .[devel], I get the following notification:"_
Hmm I was not able to replicate this. Flask-appbuilder is specified in `install_requires`, it should be installed with the above pip command. Did you see any error message while running pip install command?

_Can we make the title Airflow instead of FAB?_
Fixed

_When I try to make all the users just Admin..._

_When I go to the {Tree,Dag,..}view of the dag, the UI is full width. Is this an undocumented feature, of intentionally?_

_Unfortunately, I'm having some troubles with sqlite and the updated timezone stuff:_
